meanings.definition: To lure or entice someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object helped decoyer the bird into the cage.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman used a colorful lure to decoyer the fish.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to decoyer the rabbit with promises of a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman knew how to decoyer customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the flowers acted as a decoyer for the bees.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that lures or entices.
meanings.sent1: The decoyer in the play convinced the hero to make a wrong choice.
meanings.sent2: The decoyer in the forest led unsuspecting travelers astray.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child acted as a decoyer to get his friends in trouble.
meanings.sent4: The flashy advertisement was a decoyer for the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent5: The charming smile of the decoyer captivated everyone in the room.
